title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 214.6 - Waste heat (underfire) stacks

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 214.6 - Waste heat (underfire) stacks

State Regulations
(a) Particulate emissions from any waste heat stack must not exceed 0.050 grains
per dry standard cubic foot and the average opacity of emissions from such
stack must not exceed 20 percent as measured in accordance with the procedures
set forth in subdivision (b) of this section. (b) For the purpose of determining compliance
with subdivision (a) of this section, the observer must stand at a distance
sufficient to provide a clear view of the waste heat stack with the sun
oriented in the 140° sector of his back. The observer will, as much as
possible, make his observations from a position where his line of vision is
perpendicular to the plume direction. The opacity of emissions will be computed
by averaging the results of 24 consecutive opacity observations made at
15-second intervals. Notes
